intro: Licania lasseri, commonly known as the Brazilian licania, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Licania lasseri plays a role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various rainforest organisms.
